eg.syntax

Class SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.syntax.SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher
  • Enclosing class:
    SyntaxHighlighter

    public class SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher
extends java.lang.Object
    The search and highlighting of text elements. Class is created in the enclosing class and has no public constructor.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition(int condition)
        Sets the condition for testing if a found text element is valid. The condition is passed to Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int).
        Parameters:
        condition - a freely chosen integer. Default is 0

      • setEntireText

        public void setEntireText()
        Modifies the default section to simply the entire text

      • setSemicolonSection

        public void setSemicolonSection(boolean extendForQuoteMarks)
        Modifies the default section such that it extends to the next unquoted semicolon. The search for the next semicolon also continues so long as Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns false.
        Parameters:
        extendForQuoteMarks - the boolean value that is true to extend the section to the region that contains quote marks around the section

      • setMarkupSection

        public void setMarkupSection()
        Modifies the default section such that it corresponds to markup language elements

      • setSectionBlack

        public void setSectionBlack()
        (Re-)sets the section for highlighting during editing to black and plain. By default the section is the line where a change happened or the lines that contain a possibly multiline insertion.

      • keywords

        public void keywords(java.lang.String[] keys,
                     boolean reqWord,
                     char[] nonWordStart,
                     javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights keywords.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - the boolean value that is true to require that keywords are whole words
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that the keyword must not be preceded with. Can be null and is ignored if reqWord is false
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • extensibleKeyword

        public void extensibleKeyword(java.lang.String base,
                              java.lang.String[] extensions,
                              char[] nonWordStart,
                              javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights the keyword base which may be extended by one of the keywords in extensions.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        base - the base keyword
        extensions - the array of strings that may extend base
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that the keyword must not be preceded with. Can be null
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • signedVariables

        public void signedVariables(char[] startChars,
                            char[] endChars,
                            boolean reqWord,
                            javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights variables defined by start and end signs.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        startChars - the array of start characters
        endChars - the array of end characters
        reqWord - the boolean value that is true to require that the variables are whole words
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the variables

      • braces

        public void braces()
        Searches and highlights opening and closing braces in gray and bold.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)

      • brackets

        public void brackets()
        Searches and highlights opening and closing brackets in blue and bold.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)

      • quoted

        public void quoted(javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights quoted text in single or double quotation marks.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on quoted text

      • quotedInLine

        public void quotedInLine(javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Searches and highlights quoted text in single or double quotation marks in which a quotation must be found inside a line.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on quoted text

      • htmlElements

        public void htmlElements(java.lang.String[] tags,
                         java.lang.String[] attributes)
        Searches and highlights html elements. Tag names are shown in blue and bold, attributes in red and attribute values, if quoted, in purple.
        Parameters:
        tags - the array of html tag names
        attributes - the array of html attribute keywords

      • xmlElements

        public void xmlElements()
        Searches and highlights XML elements. Tags are shown in blue and bold, attributes in red and attribute values, if quoted, in purple.

      • embeddedHtmlSections

        public void embeddedHtmlSections(java.lang.String startTag,
                                 java.lang.String endTag,
                                 Highlighter hlSection)
        Searches sections in an html document where text elements are highlighted with a temporary Highlighter for CSS or Javascript
        Parameters:
        startTag - the start tag
        endTag - the end tag
        hlSection - the Highlighter

      • lineComments

        public void lineComments(java.lang.String lineCmntStart)
        Searches and highlights line comments in green.
        (requires that Highlighter.isValid(java.lang.String, int, int) returns true)
        Parameters:
        lineCmntStart - the line comment start

      • setSkipQuotedBlkCmntMarks

        public void setSkipQuotedBlkCmntMarks()
        Specifies that block comment marks that are quoted are skipped

      • isInBlockCmnt

        public boolean isInBlockCmnt(java.lang.String blockCmntStart,
                             java.lang.String blockCmntEnd)
        Returns if the position where a change happened is found inside a block comment
        Parameters:
        blockCmntStart - the block comment start
        blockCmntEnd - the block comment end
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if inside a block comment; false regardless of the position if the text change is multiline

      • blockComments

        public void blockComments(java.lang.String blockCmntStart,
                          java.lang.String blockCmntEnd)
        Searches and highlights block comments in green
        Parameters:
        blockCmntStart - the block comment start
        blockCmntEnd - the block comment end
